node.title: Deputy Prime Minister calls for Julian Assange to kept in Britain or returned home
node.alt: A photograph of Julian Assange through the window of what appears to be a police van.
node.description: Barnaby Joyce says Wikileaks founder Julian Assange should not be extradited to the United States, as he questions why Australia would allow its citizen to be tried there.
node.content:
["One of the government's most senior ministers has called for WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to be kept in Britain and tried there or returned to Australia.", "Mr Assange is facing extradition to the United States after the UK high court last week overturned a decision that he should not be sent to the US.", "The US government has pursued Mr Assange's extradition to face espionage charges since his organisation,\u00a0WikiLeaks, released classified military cables in 2010 and 2011.", "Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce has penned an editorial for the Nine newspapers saying Mr Assange should be tried for any crime he is alleged to have committed on British soil, or be sent home.", "\"Assange was not in breach of any Australian laws at the time of his actions. Assange was not in the US when the event being deliberated in a court now in London occurred,\" Mr Joyce wrote.", "\"The question is then: Why is he to be extradited to the US? If he insulted the Koran, would he be extradited to Saudi Arabia?\"", "", "
'Collateral Murder' depicted indiscriminate slaying of over a dozen people in the Iraqi suburb of New Baghdad, according to WikiLeaks.(Youtube: sunshinepress)
", "Liberal backbencher Bridget Archer has joined the Nationals leader and asked for a diplomatic intervention to have Mr Assange brought home.", "Mr Assange has spent the past two years in London's Belmarsh Prison, after almost a decade hiding out at the Ecuadorian embassy in the UK.\u00a0", "Yesterday, Opposition Leader Anthony Albanese said the ongoing incarceration of Mr Assange needed to end.", "Mr Albanese stopped short of demanding the government make a personal appeal to the US to drop the charges but said the current situation was untenable.", "\"Now, I don't agree with a whole range of Julian Assange's views, but there needs to be a point in which you say 'enough is enough',\" Mr Albanese said.", "A London\u00a0court refused the US extradition request in January because it deemed Mr Assange's\u00a0mental health issues made it\u00a0likely he could attempt to\u00a0take his own life if held under harsh conditions in a US federal prison.", "But that decision was overturned by the high court after the US appealed.", "Mr Assange's lawyers say they will appeal the high court ruling."]
